author: bridge-bot
content:
<glamperd> > <glamperd>  I had a brief chat with Yan, Cryptosat‚Äôs crypto guy. Trusted setups are exactly the kind of thing Cryptosat was designed for. Our computation sounds feasible. The process would be: we build the computation for their ARM processor; work with them to test on the ground; then schedule a time to upload the code and data to run on the satellite. They have 1 cubesat up, and a couple more with better capabilities launching over the next few months. If this is of interest, I guess the next step would be to explore the commercials. (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <Trent Van Epps> special contribution interest inbound to keep in mind for later

> Cryptosat.
> They launch satellites to run nodes in space.
> Barry mentioned that it might be interesting to have a satellite participate in the trusted setup for protodanksharding.)

author: chiali
content:
Hello, it was nice finally to meet you guys, i'm going to do another round of wireframe (med-fidelity) in the coming days, would you guys like to sync up for a in-depth design review with me next week? 

Originally I was planning to do first design review with other designers in EF, but I think I should start with engineer team first, since there are some information I'm not 100% certain yet.

please enter your availability here, along with your email address so you can get the automatic calendar invite.
https://lettucemeet.com/l/j0rNl

<@405860945018093609> <@550420431744794624> <@427491045308235776> <@420951281910284289> üôè

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Summary of important points from meeting:

1)  SecBit audit has started and will last for 3/4 weeks

2) Final Transcript will now include the metadata that the user used to authenticate themselves with alongside their contribution. This will be added by the coordinator.

3)  We looked over Chiali's wireframe and UI suggestions. Looks good.

Expanding a bit more:

1) SecBit have also decided to look over the Python implementation. This does not affect their original timeline.

2) An example of this metadata is: "Github: Kev" or "EthAddress: 0xdeadbeed". If a user wants to contribute privately, they will need to create a dummy account on Github or a new Eth address with nonce > 3 for example.

3) It was noted that the UI may require more information from the coordinator, such as geolocation of contributors so that you can have a global map with all of the contributors . This and other extra information required by the contributor will be discussed in the meeting above

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Next Steps:

- Currently the contributor and coordinator frontend is tightly coupeld with firebase, which will make it harder to audit, work will be done to split this up.

- Start reviewing the documentation for the front-end; front-end here meaning queue management, oAUTH,  the REST API and co-ordinator handoff, amongst other things.

- Once SecBit has finished, modify the codebase/specs with their suggestions

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> (Let me know If I missed anything important; Carl, Chiali, Geoff or anyone else whom was present)
